oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865; Oaths; Fredericksburg (Va.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Oath signed by C. S. Ferguson stating he has "permission to visit Fredericksburg upon his honor that he will not communicate in writing or verbally for publication any fact ascertained by him." Signed and issued by LeRoy Pope Walker, Confederate States of America Secretary of War.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Confederate States of America -- War Dept
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An oath of secrecy was issued by the Confederate War Department in order to prevent the knowledge of military strategies, defenses, communications, troop dispositions, and supply from being revealed.
